results.title: Down River
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gippsland”.
For some, floods are a disaster, for others a necessary lifegiving event. The quite different ecology of the riverland is explored in this Gippsland Victoria series, which gives an insight into the Gippsland region and the full scope of natural phenomenon

results.title: High country
results.creator_credit: Yenan Productions, Geoff Burrowes and George Miller
results.brief_description: A group of amateur horsemen cross Victoria’s Great Dividing Range using a little frequented track. Shows without commentary, the grandeur and mystique of the region. Music by Mario Mills and Jon English

results.title: Make Believe Play (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School Series No.4”.
Shows children’s play with paint, crayons, scrap, collage and dressing-up materials, that involves children in making and pretending. It shows the development from spontaneous play to a structured play situation

results.title: Upstream downstream
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson Film and Television Productions, South Australian Film Corporation, Igor Auzins and Peter Dimond
results.brief_description: A family takes a holiday on a houseboat on the River Murray, showing the activities and sites to be enjoyed by all age groups in the riverland’s of South Australia.

results.title: Good buy
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Yoram Gross, Yoram Gross Films and Jill Robb
results.brief_description: This animated consumer education film reveals both bad buying habits of customers and the ploys of modern marketing. It is pointed out that in buying situations the facts presented may not be quite as true as they seem, and that careful deliberation is always a good policy including the necessity of obtaining a guarantee and the reading of fine print in any signed agreement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Film Corporation, Yoram Gross, Yoram Gross Films and Jill Robb

results.title: Days I'll remember in South Australia
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Peter Dimond and Howard Rubie
results.brief_description: The star quality of the state of South Australia and one of its daughters, Julie Anthony, is revealed in this prestigious tourist film. Specially conceived music, and superb visuals combine to present the major tourist attractions of South Australia. The River Murray, Port Lincoln, the Barossa Valley, the Adelaide Hills, the Flinders Ranges, and the city of Adelaide are featured. Julie Anthony’s singing adds a special dimension to the whole film
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Film Corporation, Peter Dimond and Howard Rubie

results.title: Day of the wag
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Malcolm Smith, Milton Ingerson and John Dick
results.brief_description: The problem of truancy is the subject of this film. Various factors contributing to truancy are raised for discussion, not the least of which is the common adult practice of taking a sickie. Cast includes Sue Berny, Judy Dick, Joe DiSario, Doug Gautier and others.

results.title: Who Does the Sentence?
results.creator_credit: Victorian association for the care and resettlement of offenders, Coburg State College and Peter Johnson
results.brief_description: When a person is taken into custody, the family of the offender serve “a sentence” of another kind. The Victorian Association for the Care and Rehabilitation of Offenders (VACRO) tries to help these families in its own individual fashion. The film is noted for scenes actually filmed in Pentridge
